alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 8:29PM EST until January 05 at 8:32AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oostanaula River at US 27 at Rome affecting Floyd County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Etowah River at Canton affecting Cherokee County. For the Oostanaula River Basin...including Resaca, Calhoun, Calhoun, Armuchee, Rome, Rome, Rome, Rome...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Etowah River Basin...including Landrum, Russell Creek downstream of Head Lake Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Matt, Ball Ground, Canton, Old GA 5 below Ball Ground, Canton, Canton, Waleska, Woodstock, Noonday Creek above Chastain Meadows Pkwy Marietta, Woodstock, Woodstock, Kennesaw, Acworth, Allatoona Dam above Cartersville, Rockmart, Cartersville, Dallas, Kingston, Kingston, Rome, Rome...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Etowah River at Canton. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Minor flooding expands into the woodlands and fields along the river upstream and downstream from the gage by the Walaska Street bridge. Large portions of recreational areas such as Boling Park behind the Cherokee County High School...the Cherokee County Fairgrounds and the Etowah River Greenway at Heritage Park will be flooded with up to two feet of water. The parking lot at Boling Park will be under one foot of water. Portions of the Mill Industrial Way Road begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 17.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 PM EST Wednesday was 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 5.1 feet Monday evening. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
